name: places/ChIJIRWgs5VYwokRyp5AclZzj8c
formattedAddress: 50 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075, USA
adrFormatAddress: 50 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075-1837, USA

originalText.text: This person is the most vile human I’ve had the unfortunate experience  of encountering. She clearly enjoys spewing hatred and abuse to anyone that is unlucky enough to cross paths with her. She is demeaning, manipulative, lazy, and wildly unhygienic. Honestly I question the validity of her “MD” and encourage anyone thinking of going to her to research if she is in fact licensed to practice medicine. Her behavior is reckless and dangerous and could cost someone their life. Proceed with EXTREME caution.

originalText.text:
A lot about this experience was unprofessional, rude, uncomfortable, and unkind.....I attended two sessions with Dr. Sinsheimer and on both occasions I felt that my history and symptoms were belittled and challenged. She demanded payment up front along with a printout of benefit information from your insurer's website. Now, I understand this is a business, but I have never been to a mental health practice where I was demanded to pay before receiving services. Provide insurance card and fill out consent form first, yes, but not payment. I did these things as requested, but my printout was promptly thrusted back at me along with the statement "this means nothing to me. Call them." She refused to discuss my condition with me until an insurance agent would tell her my deductible information, and was incredibly rude to the agent while on the phone. I sat there feeling scolded and uncomfortable while the agent read off the exact information I had tried to hand her five minutes prior.

I felt that she steamrolled over my concerns about my health, symptoms, and treatment. When it came to medication, I expressed concern over documented side effects regarding the drug she had chosen, and she responded with frustration and belittlement. She said "I think you should take [drug] but you don't know WHY you don't want to" even though I had just explained why, and explained that I was uncomfortable with it and concerned. She spoke to me as if I was a foolish child for having my concerns. She tried to convince me the clinical trials were not accurate in portraying the medications I expressed interest in. I'm okay with being wrong about information, but this woman was not open to my input on my own condition, which I've been medicated for twice previously and have been managing for 7 years. She had known me for two days. I did not feel respected, heard, or cared for in any way. The second visit ended with me telling her I would be continuing elsewhere. If you are struggling emotionally, I recommend you seek treatment elsewhere with someone who will be considerate of your autonomy in your care plan.

originalText.text: Would give "0" stars but that's not an option...called her today, she answers the phone with a harsh "hello", not an introduction of who she is or a doctor's office, in the most rude way, without knowing me or my name, gives me the Spanish inquisition asking what's meds I've taken and telling me how wrong that was by the preceding - I asked if she was having a bad day, since she was so curt and rude, she said no - I said then why are you being so harsh? She made me so anxious just trying to make an appointment, I have up and hung up on her after she continued her rudeness...don't bother with this" doctor" she's more than unprofessional and rude...

She made me so anxious just trying to make an appointment, I have up and hung up on her after she continued her rudeness...don't bother with this" doctor" she's more than unprofessional and rude...

originalText.text:
I saw Dr. Sinsheimer on two separate occasions. The first 10-15 minutes of each visit (which are typically 45 minutes) involved processing insurance (which I have never encountered in my life, btw).

Dr. Sinsheimer was unaware that because she was an in-network doctor, I only had to pay $35 as a co-pay. She informed me that I would have to pay $195 for my initial consultation. I paid her $195 for my initial consultation, in cash. She ONLY accepts cash, by the way.

After my initial consultation, I called my insurance company, which informed me I should have paid $35. During my second consultation, I told her that I overpaid, and that she should refund me the balance of my over-payment. Instead of agreeing, she said that I could "work off the balance" through subsequent visits. Wholly unprofessional, when I think acceptable business practices would involve 1) refunding me my money and 2) having me pay her for each subsequent visit. There is also a "time value of money" argument that leads to the same result (i.e., refund me my money, then have me pay later) -- but I'll spare the people reading this review from explaining this.

That said, she refused to provide me with a receipt for either of my visits. I insisted that she work with my insurance carrier to refund me the money ($195 - $35 - $35 = $125). It's been two months later, and I have received word from my carrier's claims agent that she has not returned their calls. A few weeks later (today, July 28, 2015) I call her. She says she's with a patient. She probably IS with a patient. Discussing insurance instead of their emotional well being. And being a generally unprofessional professional.

I am not counting on getting my money back, and certainly can't get the time back trying to remedy this issue. I hope this review is read by enough people so they can vote with their feet and their wallets. If you enjoy being happy, I would stay away from Dr. Sinsheimer at all costs.

originalText.text: My daughter had the worst experience.  First visit too.  She left there crying when she needed someone to listen to her.  Made her anxiety worse today.  Please don't see this woman.
